summary: Email correspondence between Florence Hutner, General Counsel for the Office of Chief Medical Examiner, and an individual from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York regarding the FOIA release of Jeffrey Epstein's redacted autopsy report. The email chain discusses providing the report to The Times and giving notice to Mark Epstein's attorney.

persons.name: Florence Hutner
persons.role: General Counsel, Office of Chief Medical Examiner
persons.context: Correspondent from the Office of Chief Medical Examiner involved in the FOIA release process for Jeffrey Epstein's autopsy report.

persons.name: Mark Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as having an attorney who was to be given notice about the release of Jeffrey Epstein's redacted autopsy report.

connections.description: Hutner, as General Counsel for OCME, is involved in the FOIA release of Jeffrey Epstein's autopsy report, and communication indicates notice was to be provided to Mark Epstein's attorney.

events.title: FOIA Release of Epstein Autopsy Report
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York sends the redacted autopsy report of Jeffrey Epstein to Florence Hutner at the OCME, after having produced it to The Times and provided notice to Mark Epstein's attorney.

keyFacts: The document is an email chain regarding the FOIA release of Jeffrey Epstein's redacted autopsy report.
The redacted autopsy report was produced to The Times and was being shared with the Office of the Chief Medical Examiner.
Mark Epstein's attorney was given a courtesy notice about the release of the autopsy report.
